node.title: Democrats Put Paid Family Leave Back in Build Back Better Plan After Committee Compromise
node.alt: Paid family and medical leave were added back into the $1.75 trillion spending bill after the measures were previously dropped amid negotiations, Democrats said Wednesday. Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., arrives to meet with the Democratic Caucus at the Capitol in Washington, early Tuesday, Nov. 2, 2021.
node.description: Democrats reluctantly conceded on the key element as they attempted to scale down the price tag of the sweeping package.
node.content:
["Paid family and medical leave were added back into the $1.75 trillion spending bill after the measures were previously dropped amid negotiations, Democrats said Wednesday, the Associated Press reported.", "Democrats reluctantly conceded on the key element as they attempted to scale down the price tag of the sweeping package. But Democratic Representative Richard Neal, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, said that the committee had reached a compromise so that they could include a \"means-tested program.\"", "\"The Ways and Means Committee crafted a policy that will finally give workers and their families the peace of mind of knowing that when disaster strikes, they can rely on paid leave to avoid total crisis,\" Neal said.", "This is a breaking story and will be updated.", "", "
Paid family and medical leave were added back into the $1.75 trillion spending bill after the measures were previously dropped amid negotiations, Democrats said Wednesday. Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., arrives to meet with the Democratic Caucus at the Capitol in Washington, early Tuesday, Nov. 2, 2021.
"]
